entry.title: Binance Secures 20th Regulatory Approval as a VASP from Argentina's CNV
entry.summary:
Binance has recently registered as a Virtual Asset Service Provider with Argentina's National Securities Commission (CNV). This registration is a notable regulatory milestone for the company, marking its 20th such achievement globally. The approval allows Binance to offer its full range of services to users in Argentina. Binance Focuses on Compliance This development highlights Binance's focus on regulatory compliance. According to the company, it aims to promote safe and sustainable growth in the cryptocurrency industry, both in Argentina and worldwide. Binance has implemented a compliance program that includes anti-money laundering and counter-financing of terrorism policies.
Proud to announce that #Binance has secured registration in Argentina! ðŸ‡¦ðŸ‡·We now have 2ï¸âƒ£0ï¸âƒ£ regâ€¦

Ethereumâ€™s co-founder, Vitalik Buterin, recently discussed war-related markets on prediction betting platforms. Buterin defended the existence of the Hezbollah betting section in Polymarket, noting their role as decentralized information tools for viewers.
Vitalik Buterin Backs Hezbollah Betting Section
On Monday, the crypto community discussed the existence of war-related betting markets after X user Legendary raised concerns. The community member said that having a dedicated Hezbollah section felt wrong as it made a war â€œlook like a football game to bet on.â€
Other members shared this sentiment, and agreed with the original post. However, many others countered the concerns, arguing that predicting markets on geopolitical problems is not trivializing.

entry.title: 1 Billion Transactions Hit â€“ How Did Arbitrum Reach This Milestone So Quickly?
entry.summary:
Arbitrum recently made headlines by breaking 1 billion transactions, a monumental number for decentralized finance. Data coming in from GrowThePie reveals that operations in DeFi alone make up over 20% of all transactions; the layer 2 scaling solution proves to be widely relevant to Ethereum. This feat not only demonstrates Arbitrumâ€™s rapid expansion, but also its ability to transform the DeFi environment.
The Rise Of Arbitrage
Arbitrum, developed by Offchain Labs, is intended to address Ethereumâ€™s scalability difficulties via a mechanism known as Optimistic Rollup. This enables for speedier transaction processing and lower fees, making it a popular choice among developers and consumers alike.
Arbitrum One just hit 1 billion transactions!

entry.title: Google Searches For Bitcoin Keyword Crashes, Why This Is Bullish For Price
entry.summary:
The Google searches for the Bitcoin keyword have crashed, indicating a lack of interest among internet users in the flagship crypto. However, crypto analyst Ali Martinez has stated that this is bullish for the Bitcoin price.Â
Why The Crash In Bitcoin Google Searches Is Bullish
In an X post, Martinez revealed that nobody is searching for Bitcoin (BTC) according to Google trends. He added that this is bullish, meaning that this is a good thing for the BTC price. Typically, a surge in the search for the BTC keyword indicates a massive interest among retail investors.Â
However, the lack of interest based on Google trends indicates that retail investors have yet to come en masse into the crypto space for this bull run. Therefore, it is bullish, as there is still more room for Bitcoin â€¦

Lu discusses Magic Eden's evolution since its early days, along with valuable lessons learned in the turbulent crypto industry.

entry.summary: Crypto rises with stocks after CPI falls again. Bitfinex BTC longs continue to grow. SUI again leads L1s, up 18%. FTX estate unstakes $24m SOL, still has $943m. Binance introduces SOL liquid staking. SWIFT introduces infrastructure for RWA transfers. Pendle launches Bitcoin yield pools. UK makes crypto legal property. India leads crypto adoption for second year. Vitalik wonâ€™t advertise L2s with multi-sig security. Based rollups seen as alternative future for ETH. Blockchain music start up raises $50m. Ford & Toyota file blockchain patents.

entry.title: Fomo Hour 197 - Debate Disaster
entry.summary: Crypto falls slightly after Presidential debate. Exchanges see highest BTC outflow since May. Be wary of Yen move for BTC: Hayes. SOL active addresses hit ATH. At least 5 massive SOL announcements coming: Mert. Binomial to introduce restaking on BNB. Indonesian exchange hacked for $22m. Atomic Wallet wins lawsuit over $100m hack. Lawyers argue Ellison shouldnâ€™t go to jail. ENS integrated with Venmo & PayPal. Galaxy & State Street launch 3 crypto ETFs. Standard Chartered begins UAE crypto custody. AAVE leads resurgence in DeFi coins.

entry.title: FOMO HOUR 196 - THE INFLOWS RETURN!
entry.summary: BTC ETFs: +$29m, ETH ETFs: -$5m. BTC rallies, ETF has first inflow in 9 trading days. BTC may have put in first higher low in 6 months. Saylor predicts $13m price for BTC. Wealth advisors quickly adopting BTC: BitWise CEO. Binance among few firms to get Indonesia license. Spot trading on CEXs up 30% in August. SEC made $4.68bn from crypto firms in 2023. $5.6bn lost to scams in 2023. XRP security status may be unchallenged in appeal. EtherFi announces credit card on Scroll. Base has more DEX users than other L2s combined. Tether & Tron create taskforce against crime. TIA still only making $585 in daily fees. WLD investigated by Singapore police.

entry.title: FOMO HOUR 195 - CAN WE GET A BOUNCE?
entry.summary: BTC: 55.3k (+2%), ETH: 2320 (+1%), SOL: 130 (0%). Top Gainers: FTM, TAO, BTT, AAVE, TON, ATOM. Crypto mini-bounce continues, BTC reclaims $55k. BTC RSI hits lowest level since July 2021. Bitfinex longs continue to grow aggressively. BTC hashrate hits another ATH. BTC could hit $90k on Trump election: Bernstein. BlackRock settles intraday BTC trades off-chain. Spot BTC ETFs have been a failure: Bianco. Power giant Tepco explores Bitcoin mining. ETH Foundation & Vitalik continue to sell ETH. Farcaster DAUâ€™s down 95%.

entry.summary: Media company DASTAN, the parent company of Decrypt and Rug Radio, is embarking on the next stage of its evolution with the launch of MYRIAD, a prediction market and engagement ecosystem that aims to â€œtransform the digital media landscape.â€

entry.title: FOMO HOUR 194 - ARE NFTS BACK?
entry.summary: Crypto weak after continued ETF outflows. Durov breaks silence, TON bounces 3%. Telegram will start moderating private chats. Hayes & Brandt flip bearish on BTC. Coinbase shares hit 7 month lows. 90% of crypto firm applications rejected in UK. Japanâ€™s 3 largest banks to trial stablecoins. Trump promises again to embrace crypto. INJ launches BlackRock BUIDL index. DWF to launch synthetic stablecoin. Vitalik to donate all L2 tokens to charity. Most VCs in crypto â€˜will disappearâ€™.

entry.title: Crypto Researcher Explains Meme Coin Mania
entry.summary: Head of Research at CoinMarketCap, Alice Liu, breaks down the highs and lows of meme coin mania in 2024. Weâ€™ve seen meme coins like Dogwifhat (WIF) soar to huge market caps and weâ€™ve seen political meme coins crash as the candidate drops out (BODEN). Liu explains the data behind all of this.

entry.title: FOMO HOUR 193 - NVIDIA DROPS-OFF
entry.summary: Crypto falls on macro wobble, Yen fears. OI wiped in BTC drop to $56k, funding negative. Altcoins down 13% YTD, stablecoin supply up 30%. BTC mining profitability at record low: JP Morgan. FBI says North Korea targeting BTC ETF issuers. Trump family to launch DeFi project on ETH. Trump project linked to AVAXâ€™s Dough Finance. Trump family members hacked during launch. AI coins underperform after Nvidia investigation. MATIC upgrade to POL begins. TON falls as Telegram faces issues in many countries. VC funding & BTC correlation breaks down. We have entered cryptoâ€™s â€˜corporate phaseâ€™. Gensler will leave regardless of election: Ripple CEO. Harris campaign has asked Coinbase for advice. Penpie DeFi project hacked for $27m. Galois Capital settles with SEC over FTX custody.
